remarks: Two ways of expressing the statement "there is a cover of ` A ` by elements of ` B ` such that for each set in the cover, ` ph ` ."  Note that ` ph ` and ` x ` must be distinct.  (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 20-Jun-2010.)
statement:
cover2.1 $e |- B e. _V $.
cover2.2 $e |- A = U. B $.
cover2 $p |- ( A. x e. A E. y e. B ( x e. y /\ ph ) <-> E. z e. ~P B ( U. z = A /\ A. y e. z ph ) ) $.
$d A x z $.
$d B x y z $.
$d ph x z $.
